business.headline: Can Karisma Kapoor's children get a part of Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore empire?The lawsuit from Karisma Kapoor's children accuses their stepmother Priya Sachdeva of withholding critical information and details about Sunjay Kapur's will. The hearing for this case is scheduled for today, September 10, 2025.

Court asks Priya Kapur to list Sunjay Kapur's assets after lawsuitDelhi High Court has asked Priya Sachdev Kapur to submit a detailed list of all movable and immovable assets belonging to the late Sunjay Kapur.

Tax on gold jewellery? Here's all you need to knowWondering if your gold jewellery attracts income tax? The answer depends on whether you simply own it or decide to sell it. Here's a quick look at how the tax rules work in India.

Novo Nordisk cuts 9,000 jobs to save $1.26 billion annuallyThe company, which employs nearly 78,400 people globally, said around 5,000 of the job losses will take place in Denmark. The decision comes as Novo faces increasing pressure from its US rival Eli Lilly and slowing demand for Wegovy in key markets.

IT stocks rally big on Fed cut optimism Where to invest nowThe main driver behind IT sector rally is growing hope that the US Federal Reserve will cut interest rates soon. Lower rates would reduce costs for global businesses and boost demand for IT services.

What are homebuyers most worried about in 2025? Hint: It's not just priceThe 2025 housing market signals a clear shift. Buyers are moving beyond affordability, prioritising quality, timely delivery, and livability, even if it means paying more for premium and luxury homes.

Sensex up nearly 400 points, Nifty nears 25,000 on hopes of India-US trade talksThe S&P BSE Sensex rose over 350 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 edged close to the 25,000 mark around 9:30 am. Both indices reflected improved sentiment after five straight sessions of gains.

Urban Company IPO open for bidding today: Should you invest as GMP doubles?Ahead of the public subscription, Urban Company raised Rs 854 crore from anchor investors. Notable institutions participating in the anchor round included Government Pension Fund Global, Nomura Funds Ireland, etc.

Oracle cuts over 100 jobs in India as AI reshapes workforceOracle, which employs around 30,000 people in India, reported a revenue of Rs 20,459 crore in the year ended March 2024, a 20% jump from the previous year.

Backpacking on a budget: Smart forex tips for young travellersFor young backpackers, every rupee counts. While cheap flights and hostels often top the checklist, the way you manage foreign exchange could quietly decide whether your trip stays on budget, or slips into overspending.

Hyderabad on track to become a global tech hub: D Sridhar BabuHyderabad is aiming to become a global technology hub, focusing on innovation, start-ups, and talent development. At the India Today Conclave South 2025, D Sridhar Babu, Minister for IT, E&C, Industries & Commerce, outlined the city's vision.
Sensex ends 314 points higher, Nifty above 24,850; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 314.02 points to close at 81,101.32, while the NSE Nifty50 added 95.45 points to end at 24,868.60.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan's security enhanced, no live audience on Bigg Boss 19: MakersSecurity measures for Salman Khan on 'Bigg Boss 19' have been intensified due to ongoing threats, resulting in no live audience and strict protocols.

Jacqueline Fernandez visits child with rare condition, pledges supportBollywood actress Jacqueline Fernandez has committed to funding medical treatment for a child suffering from hydrocephalus, accompanied by philanthropist Hussain Mansuri.

Dwayne Johnson sheds weight to play a 70-year-old in Lizard MusicHollywood actor Dwayne Johnson sheds muscle for a quirky new role in 'Lizard Music', reuniting with 'The Smashing Machine' director Benny Safdie.

Karan Aujla shines in US TV debut, gets Jimmy Fallon grooving to bhangra beatsSinger-songwriter Karan Aujla recently left fans surprised after he gave bhangra lessons to 'The Tonight Show' host Jimmy Fallon. The viral video has left fans rooting for South Asian fashion and culture on international TV.

Salman to skip Bigg Boss 19 shoot, Arshad-Akshay to host Weekend Ka VaarSalman Khan will skip 'Bigg Boss 19' Weekend Ka Vaar shoot due to Battle of Galwan filming in Ladakh. Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi will replace him as hosts.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 17: Amaal revolts against Kunickaa, 4 contestants nominatedSinger Amaal Mallik went all out to support Tanya Mittal in her fight against Kunickaa Sadanand during the nomination task in 'Bigg Boss 19'. He planned to press the buzzer before the stipulated time, but was warned against it by 'Bigg Boss'.

Democracy is indivisible: Manisha Koirala echoes grandfather amid Nepal protestsActor Manisha Koirala remembered her grandfather and Nepal's first elected Prime Minister, BP Koirala, amid ongoing youth-led protests. Quoting his words, "Democracy is indivisible," she expressed solidarity with students rising against corruption and restrictions in Nepal.

Patniji will be happy: Amitabh Bachchan after being called Jayaphilic on KBC 17A 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' 17 contestant enlightened Amitabh Bachchan about the term "ambivert" and praised his enduring love for his actor-wife Jaya Bachchan.

Selena Gomez on love of Indian fans: It means the world to me | Exclusive Selena Gomez opened up about her affection for India and hopes to tour the country soon. In an exclusive interview with India Today, she also reveals her joy working alongside stars like Meryl Streep in the latest season of 'Only Murders in the Building'

Inside Deepika Padukone's daughter Dua's 1st birthday, cake baked with love by momActor Deepika Padukone baked a homemade chocolate cake to celebrate daughter Dua's first birthday. Sharing the sweet moment on Instagram, the actor gave fans a glimpse of her love-filled celebration with husband Ranveer Singh and their little one.

Fahadh Faasil to team up with Prem Kumar of Meiyazhagan fame. DetailsActor Fahadh Faasil has signed his next Tamil film in his career. The untitled film will be directed by Prem Kumar of '96' and 'Meiyazhagan' fame.

KPop Demon Hunters' Golden tops Billboard, beats BTS' Dynamite runNetflix's 'KPop Demon Hunters' reaches a major milestone as 'Golden' holds the No 1 spot on the Billboard Hot 100 for four consecutive weeks, overtaking BTS' 'Dynamite' and breaking new ground for a film soundtrack.

Akshay Kumar consoles fan as she surprises him with handmade gift on birthdayAkshay Kumar celebrated his 58th birthday by expressing gratitude to fans and receiving a touching gift from a young admirer. He kissed the young fan on her forehead, who was in tears seeing him.

Lokah crosses Rs 200 crore globally, becomes 4th highest grosser in Malayalam'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra', India and Malayalam cinema's first female superhero film, surpassed Rs 200 crore globally. The film, starring Kalyani Priyadarshan, is the fourth-highest grosser in Mollywood.

Tanya Mittal asks Premanand Maharaj, why she's not happy, his reply goes viralTanya Mittal's old video about seeking happiness during her visit to Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan has emerged online. This comes amid her entry in Salman Khan-hosted 'Bigg Boss 19'.

Steven Spielberg praises Leonardo Dicaprio's One Battle After Another: Insane filmDirector Paul Thomas Anderson's 'One Battle After Another' received high praise in its first reviews. Director Steven Spielberg and other critics praised the unique blend of absurdist comedy and intense storytelling.

Inside Bigg Boss Telugu Season 9: 9 celebs, 6 commoners, owners vs tenants format'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' premiered on September 7, 2025, bringing together nine celebrities and six commoners under the new 'Owners vs Tenants' format. The season divides the house into separate groups, setting the stage for clashes and drama as the contestants navigate the competition.

Kalyani Priyadarshan on Lokah's success: Proud to be India's 1st female superheroWith 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' drawing acclaim, Kalyani Priyadarshan is being hailed for breaking new ground as India's first female superhero. In an exclusive conversation, the actor shared how she feels about her new title.

Prajakta Koli cancels Nepal travel plan amid protests, expresses solidarityActor-Youtuber Prajakta Koli cancelled her Nepal travel plans amid Gen-Z protests, expressing concern for those affected by the unrest and a social media ban.

general news.headline: Rewrite Constitution, probe loot of 3 decades: Demand of Nepal Gen Z protestersEven after toppling PM KP Sharma Oli-led government, Nepal remained tense as Gen Z protesters pushed for constitutional overhaul and demanded a probe into the looted assets of the country.

Likewise: PM Modi responds to Trump's 'looking forward to speak' postThe positive exchange between PM Modi and US President Donald Trump comes against the backdrop of Washington's punitive 50 per cent tariffs on New Delhi over Russian oil imports roiling bilateral ties.

Trump's 'Pushpa move', double game and a $400 million betrayal of QatarA White House official said that the US was informed well in advance of Israel's strike in Qatar to target Hamas leaders. The fact the strikes occurred in Qatar, a close ally of the US that has worked to cultivate Trump, only contributed to the sense of betrayal.

The Great Nicobar Project aims to create India's Hong Kong. Why the row?India's Rs 72,000-crore Great Nicobar Project aims to build a transshipment port, airport, power plant, and township on the far-away Great Nicobar Island. Congress leader Sonia Gandhi's criticism of the project as "ill-conceived policymaking" sparked a political slugfest. So, what exactly is India's Hong Kong-like Great Nicobar Project, and how do ecological concerns weigh against strategic and economic gains?
India Today's first look at iPhone 17 AirIndia Today offers an exclusive first look at Apple's latest iPhone 17 Air, highlighting its design and key features.

Live: Army warns against vandalism, announces nationwide curfew after 5 pmNepal descended into political turmoil on Tuesday after Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli resigned, as Gen Z-led demonstrations intensified across Kathmandu and other regions. Protesters stormed government buildings, including Parliament and the Prime Minister's Office, and set ablaze the private residences of President Ram Chandra Poudel, Oli, and several former premiers. In response to the escalating crisis, the Nepal Army and top security officials jointly appealed for calm, urging dialogue as the only path to restore order. The Army vowed to safeguard the country's sovereignty, independence, and the lives and property of its citizens while closely monitoring the Gen Z-led movement.

Court asks Priya Kapur to list Sunjay Kapur's assets after lawsuitDelhi High Court has asked Priya Sachdev Kapur to submit a detailed list of all movable and immovable assets belonging to the late Sunjay Kapur.

Video: Ex-Nepal PM hit with sticks, wife punched as protesters storm their homeA dramatic video from the attack, now viral on social media, shows the minister being kicked, punched, and manhandled by protesters after they forced their way into her home. In chaotic scenes, another group of demonstrators can be seen stepping in to shield her from further blows.

Why the linguist from Mars would laugh at India's language warsLanguage wars in India might puzzle both philosophers and even a linguist from Mars. Linguist Noam Chomsky's thought experiment imagined such a Martian, who would see all human tongues as the same, mere variations of a universal grammar hardwired into us. But on Earth, those tongues become symbols of identity, culture, and pride.

New Thar flies out of Delhi showroom as lemon crushing ritual goes wrongAs part of a traditional ritual, the woman placed lemons under the tyres before driving the vehicle forward. However, she pressed the accelerator instead, causing the car to lurch forward uncontrollably.

Fly to Dubai, buy iPhone 17 Pro Max, and you will save money over buying it hereApple has finally launched the iPhone 17 series. As is always the case, the prices in India and other regions vary significantly, and in some cases so much that you can actually save money by taking a flight to Dubai, buy the iPhone 17 Pro Max there and then come back. In a manner of speaking.

Beware of wolves: Ex-Nepal PM on infiltrators among Gen Z protestersWriting from his Tokha residence in Kathmandu, Baburam Bhattarai recounted how he and his 96-year-old father narrowly escaped death after protesters set fire to his home, highlighting the personal danger posed by the unrest.

IND v UAE preview: Suryakumar Yadav's India out to justify favourites tagThe Asia Cup opens with India expected to set the tone. The defending world champions will be looking to live up to the billing of outright favourites. The UAE, meanwhile, chase pride in a rare shot against cricket's powerhouse.

What are homebuyers most worried about in 2025? Hint: It's not just priceThe 2025 housing market signals a clear shift. Buyers are moving beyond affordability, prioritising quality, timely delivery, and livability, even if it means paying more for premium and luxury homes.

996 is latest work culture craze in Silicon Valley, 5-day week can go take a hikeIt seems work culture in Silicon Valley tech companies is changing, largely driven by startups and teams that hustle. Once famed for relaxed work in companies like Google and Microsoft, the town is now host to work craze called 996, which means working from 9am to 9pm and six days a week.

Karnataka woman crushed under lorry after her scooter topples on pothole in highwayA 44-year-old Karnataka woman fell under a moving lorry after her two-wheeler toppled over a pothole on national highway near Kuluru, prompting police to register a case against driver and highway officials.

Changing the suicide narrative: Why mental health is everyone's businessSuicide rates in India highlight urgent need to change harmful narratives. Greater awareness and support systems can help prevent these avoidable deaths.

Did you know Antarctica has a surprising connection to rains in India?The study highlights the connection between ice formation in Antarctica and the evolution of the monsoon in Northeast India, through a fossil of 34 million years old.

Samsung revives old tweet to mock Apple's iPhone 17 launch with #iCantSamsung Mobile US shared a post on X in response to Apple's 'Awe-Dropping' event, saying: "#iCant believe this is still relevant".

Video: Sweden's Health Minister collapses during press meet soon after appointmentSweden's newly appointed Health Minister, Elisabet Lann, collapsed during a live press conference on Tuesday. Lann later returned, explaining the collapse was due to a "blood sugar drop."

Inside Deepika Padukone's daughter Dua's 1st birthday, cake baked with love by momActor Deepika Padukone baked a homemade chocolate cake to celebrate daughter Dua's first birthday. Sharing the sweet moment on Instagram, the actor gave fans a glimpse of her love-filled celebration with husband Ranveer Singh and their little one.

Poland shoots down Russian drones in its airspace, calls it 'act of aggression'Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said the military response was in reaction to "multiple violations of Polish airspace," and confirmed that weapons had been used against the Russian drones.

Noida woman forcibly converted to Islam, married off in Chennai; 3 arrestedA Noida woman, mother of a six-year-old, was allegedly forced into Islam by Raja Mian alias Ehsan and his family, renamed and married off through a forged nikahnama.

Keep them on: Trump asks EU for 100% tariffs on India, China over Russia oil buysDonald Trump urged the EU to impose 100 per cent tariffs on China and India, pressing for a joint transatlantic effort to cut Russia's oil revenues and intensify economic pressure on Vladimir Putin.

sports.headline: Updated WWE Wrestlepalooza Card revealed: 2 new matches confirmedWrestlepalooza 2024 features star-studded matches including Cena vs Lesnar. AJ Lee's return and new rivalries promise unforgettable moments.

UAE captain Muhammad Waseem hoping to give India a run for their moneyUAE captain Muhammad Waseem has expressed confidence ahead of Asia Cup 2025 opener against India. The team aims to leverage home conditions and challenge favourites India in the tournament.

FIDE Grand Swiss: Gukesh suffers second loss, Erigaisi, Vaishali stay in huntWorld champion D Gukesh suffers defeat in the World Cup Swiss tournament, impacting his chances for Candidates 2026. Meanwhile, Arjun Erigaisi and R Vaishali maintain strong positions, setting up a tense final phase.

VALORANT Champions 2025: Group C stacked with Liquid, EDG, NRG, and DRXGroup C at Valorant Champions 2025 promises intense competition among top teams. The battle will test legacies, strategy adaptations, and resilience on the global stage.

Litton Das shines bright, but can Bangladesh turn brilliance into glory?Bangladesh have shown steady improvement in T20 cricket under captain Litton Das. Their balanced squad and recent series wins raise hopes for a strong Asia Cup 2025 performance.

Jonathan Trott warns Afghanistan after Hong Kong rout in Asia Cup: We've won nothingAfghanistan won their opening Asia Cup match against Hong Kong but showed inconsistency in performance. Coach Jonathan Trott warned that individual brilliance won't suffice against stronger teams ahead.

New Zealand name strong squad for Women's World Cup, Fran Jonas left outNew Zealand announces a 15-member squad for the upcoming ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 without left-arm spinner Fran Jonas. Instead, the White Ferns picked Flora Devonshire.

Asia Cup 2025: India must avoid complacency against smaller teams, says Robin UthappaRobin Uthappa has urged the Indian cricket team to avoid complacency as they start their Asia Cup 2025 campaign against UAE. He stressed the need for team unity and warned about dark horses like Afghanistan posing a serious challenge.

Sanju Samson, Jasprit Bumrah miss optional training ahead of Asia Cup openerIndia held their optional practice session a day before their Asia Cup opener. Sanju Samson and Jasprit Bumrah did not opt for practice on Tuesday, September 9.

Know Your Opponents: United Arab Emirates, tournament hosts who aim to leave a markThe United Arab Emirates, under the leadership of Muhammad Waseem, will look to establish themselves as one of the emerging teams with a strong showing in Asia Cup 2025.

Kuldeep Yadav might play in the Asia Cup: Ex-spinnerKuldeep Yadav did not play a single match in India's Test series against England. Will Kuldeep Yadav feature in India's playing XI in Asia Cup 2025?

New Zealand name strong squad for Women's World Cup, Fran Jonas left outNew Zealand announces a 15-member squad for the upcoming ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 without left-arm spinner Fran Jonas. Instead, the White Ferns picked Flora Devonshire.

He stressed the need for team unity and warned about dark horses like Afghanistan posing a serious challenge.

Sanju Samson, Jasprit Bumrah miss optional training ahead of Asia Cup openerIndia held their optional practice session a day before their Asia Cup opener. Sanju Samson and Jasprit Bumrah did not opt for practice on Tuesday, September 9.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
